title: Edit a budget record
content:
You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Financials > Budgets. The Budgets page is displayed.

  2. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  3. Click the tab you want to view or edit. The General tab is displayed by default.

    Tab Description
    General Displays details of the selected record. For more information, see the General tab section.
    Workflow Displays the workflow for the selected record. For more information about the workflow, see Budget workflow.
    Budget lines Displays a budget analysis view and any relevant budget lines for the selected record. For more information about the budget lines, see the Budget lines tab section.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the selected record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.
    History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.

  4. Save your changes.

General tab

This tab includes the following sections:

Details

Field Description
Title External (common) name of the budget record.
Description Description that captures the details of the budget record.
Budget center Budget center for the budget record.
Code Internal code for the budget.
Created by The name of the user who created the budget.
Creation Time The time that the budget record was created.

Attachments

Click Add attachment if you want to attach a file to the record.

Note

  • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.
  • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.
  • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

Budget lines tab

This tab includes a budget analysis view and a budget lines section.

Budget analysis view

The budget analysis view provides a chart showing the comparison of the planned budget and the actual expense incurred in the same accounting period.

To compare the actual expenditure with the planned budget, make sure that:

  • The budget line and the incurred expense lines have the same accounting period.
  • The cost center of the expense lines matches the cost center linked to the budget center record of the budget line.
  • The cost type of the expense lines matches the cost type linked to the budget type record of the budget line.

For each budget line, the stacked bar shows the expenditure (debits) within the budget, the remaining budget, and the overspend amount when applicable. You can click to view the associated expense lines.

Note: The chart won’t display if there’re more than 40 budget lines.

Budget lines

The budget lines section shows all budget lines created for the budget.
